name: Crowne Plaza London - The City

reviews.text: I arrived at the hotel with a privat shuttle from the airport - a bellman took my suitcase and guided me to the check in desk. That was fast and very friendly and personal! (Mirko was the best)
reviews.title: great location - friendly front desk

reviews.text: The same bellman brought me and my bag to the room and showed me everything in it. The bed is nice, but not as nice as the most US chains with their sleeper beds. Comp. water was in the room for the first night.
reviews.title: Beware of Room 104

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great - if you walk 15 - 20 minutes you can reach most tourist stuff in downtown London. GREAT!!
reviews.title: okay but not brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After the first night, the cleaning lady knocked multiple times at my door and even opened it - well, there was a do not disturb sign out?! Why was she doing this? I complaint at the front desk and they dealed with the situation from their on.
reviews.title: Brilliant location for London stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel, good service but not a service heaven.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location

likes.disliked: — Not much of a view from some rooms (garage)

reviews.title: great place!
reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights and had a great experience. Would definitely stay again if I got a good rate.
Pros:
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -good location -- Starbucks is right across the street, as is Blackfriar's tube statation. There are some good restaurants closeby as well.
reviews.title: Great if you get a deal

reviews.text: Quite on the expensive side, but definitely worth every penny it costs to stay here. The suite was outstanding, and the service encompassed precisely that "little extra" you would expect at a hotel of this standard.
reviews.title: Every penny's worth!

reviews.text: My friend and I arrived on Saturday for a week-end theatre break and from the outset we were impressed with the hotel. I had e-mailed them before hand to request an "outer" room with a view,and as a result they very kindly up-graded us from a standard twin room to a de-luxe room with two double beds, which were very comfy, although we were only looking out on an office block at least we had a very large window with light which is what we wanted.
reviews.title: Like sleeping on a cloud!

reviews.text: The room was very clean and modern and the beds,bedding and pillows were exceptionally comfortable, it was like sleeping on a cloud. The bathroom was clean and bright with everything you would need for your stay,bathrobes, toiletries etc.There was an iron and ironing board in the cupboard, also tea and coffee making facilities with snacks. As mentioned in other reviews, the lack of electric sockets was a bit confusing, until we found them on the side of the T.V. stand / desk! Great for the hairdryer or phone charger.
reviews.title: Great place to stay, despite construction

reviews.text: Another thing that was mentioned in other reviews was the "erratic lifts". You had to swipe your room card in the slot before pressing the appropriate floor number. We were actually told this by the very friendly receptionist, but we did meet several people in there who had spent several minutes going up and down and getting nowhere. They maintained they had not been told, but I suspect some people don`t listen!
reviews.title: Beyond perfection!

reviews.text: The best thing about the hotel was the staff. By far the best we have come across in a hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable Urban Hotel in the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights over the Easter Weekend. Booked a King Studio and was upgraded to a One Bedroom Suite. The room was relatively small for a suite and did not have a separate shower but we were very pleased overall.
reviews.title: A Very Good Stay

likes.liked: — The upgrade and the facilities in the room
likes.disliked: — It could feel a bit sterile at times

reviews.text: The room has a dvd player, a cd player and an i-pod player. The room was extremely clean and housekeeping offered a turndown service both nights
reviews.title: Beat My expectations - Loved this Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel itself was farily quiet as it is mainly a business hotel and this being Easter, the City of London was deserted. However, the tube station is right outside and the west end is 10 mins away.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience
Classy Hotel
reviews.text: I would definitely return at the right price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my wife and 2 small kids (5 & 3). Was very nervous at first, because it had mixed reviews, but overall, had a great time!
reviews.title: Not bad at all

likes.liked: — cleanliness, distance to tube station, price

reviews.text: I got a good deal on a room here through GTAHotels.com, and it's now the hotel I check first when looking for a room in London. The location is excellent for sightseeing - a few seconds' walk from the Thames - and it couldn't be any easier to get to from the tube station, provided you get the right exit. Admittedly there's not a lot of nightlife in the immediate area, but that's probably a good thing if you're after a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Top hotel

reviews.text: The first room we were given had a distinctly nasty smell about it, but the receptionist gave us a different room with no questions asked and to be fair on the staff it took me a LOT of looking to find the source of the smell. The replacement room overlooked the atrium, which is a bit on the small side but still provides enough daylight, at least on the higher floors.
reviews.title: Convenient and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was pretty extensive and served usefully late into the morning. The eggs could possibly have done with another few seconds of cooking but otherwise the food was nice. We also tried the bar, which is classy with good service, but expensive.
reviews.title: Lost our booking

reviews.text: Overall I'm definitely looking forward to my next stay here.
reviews.title: My favourite place

likes.disliked: — Book a table at the Italian Restaurant........the anti pasti (italian cheese and meat) to start with is 5star deluxe

reviews.text: I received a warm welcome from the receptionist, who proceeded to check me in quickly. The room was very nicely furnished and reasonably spacious. As it was at the front of the hotel on the second floor there was some traffic noise, but this was acceptable and certainly not intrusive. Breakfast the next morning (included in the rate) was good.
reviews.title: Great Sight Seeing Hotel

reviews.text: First of all the good:
reviews.title: The Good, the bad and the ugly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Location - two minutes from Blackfriars Bridge which can get you to Gatwick nice and quickly. Not far from Waterloo which is where I came into it.
reviews.title: Well Pleased

reviews.text: Nice lobby and reservation was ready.
reviews.title: Really Good Hotel for Families or Business in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Club lounge. Nice room - fresh, modern. Comfortable bed. Great shower.
reviews.title: First Class!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the bad:
reviews.title: Good location, will be even better when the tube reopens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great stay. Was very impressed with the state of the hotel and with the reception staff. The room was great with lovely touches such as the sleep pack. Cant fault the accommodation in any way. The bar was an excellent place to relax with perfect ambience. The only thing that slightly let the whole thing down was the restaurant and these are only small complaints. The starter of assorted breads was brought out halfway through the main course and the wine was awful. I told the waiter and said I couldn't drink any more unless we had lemonade to add to it, it would have been nice if he had changed the wine rather than bring a small bottle of lemonade. But as I said these were small blemishes on an otherwise nice stay.
reviews.title: Great hotel just a slight blemish with restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel will not disappoint. We stayed here for a weekend while the NFL was in town. It was a great location to walk to many places including Trafalgars Square & the London Eye. The rooms were spacious and clean. The beds were comfy and the pillows were as well. Check in was a little show due to the customer's deposit ahead of us. Staff was very nice. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good weekend spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on a 3 day trip to London. Hotel was in a good position next to Blackfriars bridge. Staff very friendly and helpful and rooms were clean, well-equipped and spacious, also very comfortable beds. Excellent buffet breakfast, Sunday it was served 7 - 11 which was great if you wanted a lie-in, didn't feel the need to rush.
reviews.title: lovely hotel would stay here again

reviews.text: Was just opposite a lovely,quirky old pub (called Blackfriars) which does good food and has lovely ambience, we spent a very happy couple of hours there! Hotel is also next to a tube station (although this wasn't open when we were there due to repairs) but two other tube stations (Temple & Embankment) were only a short walk away. I would recommend this hotel and we would definitely use it again.
reviews.title: Great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Super hotel in a great location. Rooms are clean and spacious and the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. They have obviously gone to a lot of trouble to make sure you have a good nights sleep. The sheets and duvets were beautifully crisp and fresh, definitely not the usual hotel bed. Our room was very quiet considering the central london location. Breakfast was excellent, even the scrambled egg was good. I would visit the hotel again without hesitation.
reviews.title: First class attention all the way

reviews.text: I feel i got too llttle for what i expected. Cheaply done, with lotsof trainees as employees everywhere and little other service. Not recommended
reviews.title: Not up to crown plaza standards

reviews.text: My wife and I had a great stay at the Crowne Plaza, London this October. Very clean, comfortable room. comfortable bed and linens,towels very absorbent. Large Room.. Good bath and shower. Staff was always helpful. Breakfast buffet was good. All in all we would book there again if we can get back to London.
reviews.title: most comfortable/Crown Plaza London

likes.disliked: — Hard to climb in and out of bathtub

reviews.text: Especially, contrasted with a much larger hotel in Paris which was next on our trip this hotel is outstanding.
reviews.title: Fantastic customer service at this Crowne Plaza

reviews.text: Have stayed at a number of Crowne Plazas, but this one really does stand out. Excellent customer service - really felt valued as a customer right from the moment I walked in the door.
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist even showed me around the hotel.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: I have stayed and reviewed the hotel before and have used it again for a weekend in London with a friend. It may not be so close to an open underground station but it is well located.
reviews.title: Execllent standard

reviews.text: The room is of great quality and for friends sharing you get two good sized beds and lots of space.
reviews.title: Fantastic stayM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a member of the 241hotelclub.com I got two nights for the price of one (scheme is for Holiday Inn / Crwin Plazas) so this was good value.
reviews.title: Great City spot - ideal business hotel

reviews.text: This time I headed to Smithsfield area for dinner which was about half a mile away. Great area and off the tourist route somewhat. We ate at the Smithfield Bar and Grill which has a great bar and restaurant, Booked via toptable.co.uk and had 50% off the food bill. Bargain.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.text: Back to the hotel, my only complaint is no free wi-fi. I say this every time I am in a hotel where I would expect this and hotels should wake up to this. I don't have to pay for TV so why should I pay for wi-fi? It is a basic service and given a choice between the two I would choose wi-fi
reviews.title: Not as impressive as hoped

reviews.text: This was my first time staying in the Crowne Plaza London City. Given that there was quite a lot of snow that morning ( February 8th February ) I was delighted to find the hotel directly opposite Blackfriars station.
reviews.title: Truly excellent
It's fine. Not great, just fine
reviews.text: Despite the early hour, there was no quibble about checking in and having a coffee in the Club Lounge whilst rooms were being prepared. However, there was a heart stopping moment when there was a query about my reservation, and there didn't appear to be any room at the inn!!

A very helpful manager (Kati) sorted the matter, which was down to no more than human error. She very kindly upgraded me to a studio room and offered a complimentary lunch. It is so rare to find this sort of attitude in a large hotel chain, and it did wonders in restoring my spirits.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel on a perfect city

likes.disliked: — The view (to the center of the hotel)

reviews.text: The Studio room has a dining table, desk and sofa bed, as well as a very comfortable king bed. The bathroom was nicely finished with and came with Molton Brown toiletries.
reviews.title: Very Highly Recommended

likes.liked: — Clean, great location, friendly, good value for money

reviews.text: As well as the usual tea facility, there was a coffee maker (no instant here!) with biscuits, and complimentary wine and nuts.
reviews.title: Can't be faulted - Fantastic stay

reviews.text: The Crowne Plaza City is easily accessible from the Blackfriars tube station (exit 8 I think), and there are two entrances to this hotel, but both take you to reception, whether you decide to enter the hotel via either way.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, but the view?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception is very large open plan, wonderful comfy couches, huge gas fire, and a very beautiful silver clock. Receptionists were efficient, gave me two card keys without me having to ask, and we were directed to our room. Now here comes the fun bit.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel had agreed to upgrade us to a better room than we had originally booked (this is the first time in 5 years of staying with the ICH group of hotels I hasten to add!), and whilst the room was nice and cosy (see pics), the view was indescribably bad! I immediately closed the curtains and left them closed all weekend. You must see the pics to understand what I mean. This was room 609, there were also other rooms facing this white facade. I would have thought that a hotel of this calibre would at least try to make a boring view a little more interesting for its paying guests, but hey!
reviews.title: Best London hotel to date

reviews.text: The hotel, whilst busy, appeared quiet. The Crowne plazas must do something to fire doors/room doors/lift doors, to make them extra quiet, and I like this feature of the hotel. Why holiday inns aren't as quiet, I will never know!
reviews.title: Liked the room, the location and the price.

likes.liked: — Spacious room, strategic location, attentive staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were at least two chairs to relax in the bedroom, and the room had a very comfy bed/tea/coffee making facilities to make you feel at home. The furniture showed a little sign of wear and tear (the hanger in the wardrobe fell off as I placed a blouse in it!), but good quality fittings throughout.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed at this hotel for two nights using points from Holiday Inn but have stayed at better quality Holiday Inns - expected Crowne Plaza to be better.
reviews.title: Close to city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: nice hotel with good facilities including gym. Wifi £5 per hour and room service available.
reviews.title: What a Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bar prices extortionate not to mention the optional 10% service charge added to everything.
reviews.title: Valentines Day in London

reviews.text: beds were comfy and room really nice.
reviews.title: till next time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: local tube station is Blackfriars - PLEASE NOTE THIS TUBE STATION CLOSES ON 2ND MARCH 2009 FOR 2 YEARS - next nearest tube is 12 mins walk away.
reviews.title: Quality hotel with excellent location.

aka: Crowne Plaza London - The City Hotel London
description: Crowne Plaza London - The City Hotel provides perfect accommodation in central London near local attractions such as The London Eye, St Paul’s Cathedral and Buckingham Palace. This luxury hotel also offers meeting rooms, gym, spa facilities and a Michelin star restaurant. The Crowne Plaza London – The City Hotel is a modern central London hotel, located in the heart of the city. This deluxe London hotel is just a stone’s throw away from Blackfriars mainline train station, with a direct connection to the Eurostar terminal at St. Pancras International. For tubes, the Crowne Plaza hotel is equally well located: just a short walk to Temple & Mansion House on the District & Circle Line, or St Paul's on the Central Line. Whether you’re in London for business or sightseeing, this London City Centre hotel is ideally located, minutes away from some of London's most famous attractions: The London Eye, St Paul's Cathedral, Millennium Bridge, Tate Modern & West End theatres. Crowne Plaza Club rooms, King Studios and Suites are available at your request. And all rooms are air-conditioned and have High Speed Internet Access. There’s also a Fitness Club with sauna in the hotel should you wish to work out and wind down. While you’re here, don’t forget to eat in at our award-winning restaurant, Refettorio, directed by Michelin-starred Chef Giorgio Locatelli offering some of the finest Italian food in London. Chinese Cricket Club, a destination Chinese restaurant set within Crowne Plaza London - The City, has attracted much acclaim for its menu of Sichuan specialist with a modern twist. The easiest and most exciting way to do some sightseeing in London city centre is to take a trip on the London Eye. On a clear day, you can see as far as the Queen’s other residence, Windsor Castle! The Crowne Plaza London City Hotel is only minutes away from the London Eye.
